titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. F. M. Shrader, Indictment

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
McLean Circuit Court
Mar Term 1864
The Commonwealth of Ky
Aganist } Indictment
F M Shrader
The Grand Jury of McClean County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse F M Shrader of the crime of Murder, Committed as follows.

The said F. M. Shrader on the day of October 1863. in the County aforesaid did feloniously, and with malice and aforethought, kill and Murder James Roberts, by shooting him with a gun loaded with powder and leaden balls against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Information by
L Brackett
D Little
Martha Little
Thornley Atcherson.
After being continued from, time to time the following order was made at September, term 1866 of said Court
"This day came, The Commonwealth by her Attorney and on his motion this cause is stricken from, The Docket, with leave granted to Reinstate

A Copy Attest Louis L Moore clk
for A J Moore Dr

Commonwealth Ky
v
F M Shrader
